title: Memoirs of the Life of Sir Walter Scott, Volume 6
author: Lockhart, J. G. (John Gibson)
snippet: They usuallycontrived to meet on a Friday; spent the Saturday in a ride to somescene of historical interest within an easy distance; enjoyed a quietSunday at home--"duly attending divine worship at the Kirk of Cleish(not Cleishbotham)"--gave Monday morning to another antiquarianexcursion, and returned to Edinburgh in time for the Courts ofTuesday.

title: Memoirs of the Life of Sir Walter Scott, Volume 6
author: Lockhart, J. G. (John Gibson)
snippet: They usuallycontrived to meet on a Friday; spent the Saturday in a ride to somescene of historical interest within an easy distance; enjoyed a quietSunday at home--"duly attending divine worship at the Kirk of Cleish(not Cleishbotham)"--gave Monday morning to another antiquarianexcursion, and returned to Edinburgh in time for the Courts ofTuesday.

title: Notes of foreign travel.
author: Bates, James Hale
snippet: The lake is oval in shape,, nearly four miles long by about two wide, a charming sheet of water set among tranquil hills — Benarty, Lomond, Cleish, Ochil — with peaceful meadows at their feet.

title: Scotland Picturesque and Traditional. A pilgrimage with staff and knapsack
author: Todd, George Eyre.
snippet: in Beaton's Mill; and it was a Stirling of Keir who, with fifty followers,waylaid poor Meldrum of Cleish under the walls of Holyrood, and left him for dead withhis legs houghed and the knobs of his elbows struck off.
